sections.heading: in charging offense; jury; discharge prior to verdict
sections.text: When a jury has been impaneled in a case contemplated by section 29-2018, such jury may be discharged without prejudice to the prosecution.SourceG.S.1873, c. 58, § 481, p. 829;R.S.1913, § 9122;C.S.1922, § 10147;C.S.1929, § 29-2019;R.S.1943, § 29-

29-2019.Mistake in charging offense; jury; discharge prior to verdict.

When a jury has been impaneled in a case contemplated by section 29-2018, such jury may be discharged without prejudice to the prosecution.

SourceG.S.1873, c. 58, § 481, p. 829;R.S.1913, § 9122;C.S.1922, § 10147;C.S.1929, § 29-2019;R.S.1943, § 29-2019.
